    Brainvr.R showcase of loading and preprocessing

    Lukáš hejtmy Hejtmánek

    2020-10-26

    main.Rmd

    Loading single experiemnt

    Loading single experiment the first time

    library(brainvr.reader)
    ## Loading required package: navr
    ## Loading required package: ggplot2
    dir_path <- system.file("extdata/CFNS/", package = "brainvr.reader")
obj <- load_experiments(dir_path)
    ## Loading preprocessed player log C:/Users/hejtm/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpOgFPi0/temp_libpath25d010597976/brainvr.reader/extdata/CFNS/NEO_player_17-41-52-03-12-2017_preprocessed.txt
    ## Loading preprocessed player log C:/Users/hejtm/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpOgFPi0/temp_libpath25d010597976/brainvr.reader/extdata/CFNS/NEO_player_18-07-09-03-12-2017_preprocessed.txt
    obj <- obj[[1]]

    Recentering map

    IN case we need a new offset, we can do that as well

    obj <- translate_positions(obj, c(33.5, 0, 47.75))
    ## Warning in transform_object.brainvr(obj, "translate", translate_positions_df, : Couldn't translate positions in player log.
##                  Have you preprocessed it correctly? Quitting.
    obj <- mirror_axes(obj)
    ## Warning in transform_object.brainvr(obj, "mirror", mirror_positions_df, : Couldn't mirror positions in player log.
##                  Have you preprocessed it correctly? Quitting.

    Visualising

    Plotting player path

    #set constraints
obj$data$position$area_boundaries <- list(x = c(-5, 105), y = c(-5, 105))
